programme.title: Mission: Impossible (1996)
programme.desc: A crack team of spies try to determine who sabotaged a mission to find crucial computer information.

programme.title: The Agency
programme.desc: Henry questions Martians thinking. Bosko is briefed by Langley on a top-secret operation. Poppy makes a startling discovery. Martian confronts Sami about why shes in London and finds a needle in a haystack, before a heated session with Dr. Blake.

programme.title: Once Upon a Time in America (1984)
programme.desc: Sergio Leones epic chronicles the rise and fall of Jewish mobsters in Brooklyn over 50 years. Robert De Niro, James Woods. Deborah: Elizabeth McGovern. ODonnell: Treat Williams. Carol: Tuesday Weld. Joe: Burt Young. Frankie: Joe Pesci.

programme.title: Coach Carter (2005)
programme.desc: Samuel L. Jackson brings his A-game to this inspiring and eloquent fact-based sports drama. He plays a no-nonsense California high-school basketball coach who demands that his cocky, undisciplined players be responsible on and off the court. Rob Brown, Robert Richard, Debbi Morgan, Ashanti, Rick Gonzalez, Antwon Tanner, Nana Gbewonyo, Denise Dowse, Mel Winkler.

programme.title: The Firm (1993)
programme.desc: A young lawyer discovers the firm hes hired into is controlled by the mob and attempts to escape from their clutches.

programme.title: John Grishams The Rainmaker (1997)
programme.desc: In this gripping adaptation, a naive young lawyer and his experienced partner take on a corrupt insurance company in the court case of a lifetime.

programme.title: The Italian Job (2003)
programme.desc: A team of high-class thieves set out to avenge their mentors death with the help of his daughter. The plan consists of them stealing a fortune in gold, having it pilfered from them and then trying to get it back.

programme.title: Casino Royale (2006)
programme.desc: James Bond tries his hand at outwitting a terrorist banker.

programme.title: Shaft (2000)
programme.desc: Dynamic Samuel L. Jackson stars as New York City cop John Shaft, who quits the force and decides to dispense his own brand of vigilante justice against a racist killer (Christian Bale) and a Dominican drug lord (Jeffrey Wright). Richard Roundtree, who played the original John Shaft in three 70s crime dramas, has a cameo as Jacksons uncle and namesake. Busta Rhymes, Vanessa Williams, Dan Hedaya.

programme.title: Ghost (1990)
programme.desc: A murdered New York banker returns to protect his girlfriend, with help from a psychic.

programme.title: Her (2013)
programme.desc: A lonely writer falls for his computers operating system, which has the voice of a woman and the ability to grow and learn. Their relationship quickly turns more intimate, but in time their differences begin to outweigh their similarities. Meanwhile, he struggles with a difficult divorce from his childhood sweetheart.

programme.title: The Matrix (1999)

programme.title: The Knick

programme.title: The Knick
programme.desc: Thackery refuses to collaborate with Dr. Zinberg on blood-transfusion research; Cornelia and Edwards arrive at a crossroads; Barrow trades one creditor for another; Lucy requests Bertie's help.

programme.title: The Devil Wears Prada
programme.desc: A recent college graduate (Anne Hathaway) lands a job working for a famous and diabolical editor (Meryl Streep) of a New York fashion magazine.

programme.title: The Lovers
programme.desc: A man and his wife, each embroiled in an extramarital affair, are sent reeling when they suddenly fall for the least likely person imaginable -- each other.

programme.title: I, Tonya
programme.desc: In 1991, talented figure skater Tonya Harding becomes the first American woman to complete a triple axel during a competition. In 1994, her world comes crashing down when her ex-husband conspires to injure fellow Olympic hopeful Nancy Kerrigan.

programme.title: Bachelorette
programme.desc: After ruining their friend's wedding gown, bridesmaids (Kirsten Dunst, Isla Fisher, Lizzy Caplan) set out on a frantic search for a replacement, but their mission degenerates into a night of booze, drugs and nightclubbing.

programme.title: Mona Lisa Smile
programme.desc: In 1953 a professor (Julia Roberts) of art history challenges her female students (Kirsten Dunst, Julia Stiles) to re-examine the traditional roles of women.

programme.title: Four Weddings and a Funeral
programme.desc: An English charmer (Hugh Grant) and a lusty American (Andie MacDowell) make love over a course of surprising events.

programme.title: Four Weddings and a Funeral
programme.desc: An English charmer (Hugh Grant) and a lusty American (Andie MacDowell) make love over a course of surprising events.

programme.title: Breathe
programme.desc: After contracting polio at the age of 28, Robin Cavendish is confined to a bed and given only months to live. With help from his family and inventor Teddy Hall, Cavendish devotes the rest of his life to helping fellow patients and the disabled.

programme.title: Take This Waltz
programme.desc: A young woman (Michelle Williams) is torn between the husband (Seth Rogen) that she loves and a new man (Luke Kirby) in her life, whom she's unable to ignore.

programme.title: Great Expectations
programme.desc: In a modern adaptation of Dickens' classic, an artist (Ethan Hawke) deals with rejection from his childhood sweetheart (Gwyneth Paltrow).

programme.title: Black Swan
programme.desc: A ballerina (Natalie Portman) begins to lose her fragile grip on reality as a sultry newcomer (Mila Kunis) threatens to usurp her position as the lead dancer in "Swan Lake.".

programme.title: The Family
programme.desc: After snitching on the mob, a Mafia boss (Robert De Niro) and his family enter the Witness Protection Program and relocate to a sleepy town in France, but their insistence on resorting to their old habits places them in danger from vengeful cronies.

programme.title: San Andreas
programme.desc: When the San Andreas fault triggers a magnitude 9 earthquake, a search-and-rescue helicopter pilot (Dwayne Johnson) must navigate the destruction from Los Angeles to San Francisco to bring his estranged wife (Carla Gugino) and daughter to safety.

programme.title: Eye in the Sky
programme.desc: A lieutenant general (Alan Rickman) and a colonel (Helen Mirren) face political opposition after ordering a drone missile strike to take out a group of suicide bombers in Nairobi, Kenya.

programme.title: White Bird in a Blizzard
programme.desc: A teenager (Shailene Woodley) relishes her newfound freedom after her disturbed mother (Eva Green) vanishes, but the strange facts of the disappearance soon begin to haunt her.

programme.title: The Eyes of My Mother
programme.desc: After tragedy strikes her idyllic family life in the countryside, a woman's (Kika Magalhaes) desire to reconnect with the world takes a dark form.

programme.title: Wes Craven Presents: Dracula 2000
programme.desc: A London antiques dealer (Christopher Plummer) travels to New Orleans to save his estranged daughter from his nemesis, Count Dracula (Gerard Butler).

programme.title: Sinister
programme.desc: A true-crime novelist (Ethan Hawke) and his family become the targets of a supernatural entity when he uses found footage to unravel the murders of his home's previous occupants.

programme.title: Hobo With a Shotgun
programme.desc: Hoping for heaven but finding an urban hell, a homeless man (Rutger Hauer) takes aim at a crime boss and the man's sadistic sons (Gregory Smith, Nick Bateman).

programme.title: The Trust
programme.desc: Corrupt cops working in the police department evidence room make plans to rob a vault full of drug money in the back of a convenience store.

programme.title: The Hunger Games: The Ballad of Songbirds & Snakes
programme.desc: With the annual Hunger Games approaching, 18-year-old Coriolanus Snow is assigned to mentor Lucy Gray Baird. Uniting their instincts for showmanship and political savvy, they race against time to ultimately reveal who's a songbird and who's a snake.

programme.title: Ordinary Angels
programme.desc: A struggling hairdresser finds a renewed sense of purpose when she meets a widowed father and his two daughters. With his youngest critically ill and waiting for a liver transplant, the fierce woman rallies an entire community to help.

programme.title: The Perfect Christmas
programme.desc: On Christmas Eve, the Perfect family experiences a series of outrageous misadventures, pranks and criminal activities that may jeopardize their perfect Christmas.

programme.title: The Fabelmans
programme.desc: Young Sammy Fabelman falls in love with movies after his parents take him to see "The Greatest Show on Earth." Armed with a camera, Sammy starts to make his own films at home, much to the delight of his supportive mother.

programme.title: Joy Ride
programme.desc: Follows four Asian American friends as they embark on an epic, no-holds-barred journey of bonding, belonging and wild debauchery that reveals the universal truth of what it means to know and love who you are.

programme.title: Cocaine Bear
programme.desc: An oddball group of cops, criminals, tourists and teens converges in a Georgia forest after a 500-pound black bear ingests a large amount of cocaine and goes on a drug-fueled rampage.

programme.title: Bros
programme.desc: Repeatedly drawn to each other, two commitment-phobic men begin to show their vulnerable sides as their undeniable attraction turns into something resembling a relationship.

programme.title: Vengeance
programme.desc: A journalist and podcaster travels from New York City to Texas to investigate the death of a woman whom he hooked up with.

programme.title: Silent Night
programme.desc: On Christmas Eve, a man witnesses the death of his young son when the boy gets caught in crossfire between warring gangs. Recovering from a wound that cost him his voice, he soon embarks on a bloody and grueling quest to punish those responsible.

programme.title: The Night Before
programme.desc: As their annual reunion tradition comes to an end, three lifelong friends (Joseph Gordon-Levitt, Seth Rogen, Anthony Mackie) plan a night of debauchery and hilarity by searching for the Nutcracka Ball, the Holy Grail of Christmas parties in New York.

programme.title: The Unholy
programme.desc: A disgraced journalist investigates a girl who can inexplicably heal the sick after a supposed visitation from the Virgin Mary. However, when strange events start to occur, he soon wonders if these phenomena are the result of something more sinister.

programme.title: Only the Brave
programme.desc: The Granite Mountain Hotshots become one of the most elite firefighting teams in the country. Watching over lives, homes and everything people hold dear, they forge a unique brotherhood that comes into focus with one fateful fire in Yarnell, Ariz.

programme.title: Armageddon Time
programme.desc: A coming-of-age story about the strength of family and the generational pursuit of the American dream.

programme.title: Armageddon Time
programme.desc: A coming-of-age story about the strength of family and the generational pursuit of the American dream.

programme.title: Arthur the King
programme.desc: Michael Light and a team of athletes compete in the Adventure Racing World Championship. As they get pushed to the outer limits of endurance, a dog named Arthur comes along for the ride, redefining what victory, loyalty and friendship truly means.

programme.title: Expend4bles
programme.desc: Armed with every weapon they can get their hands on, the Expendables are the world's last line of defense and the team that gets called when all other options are off the table.

programme.title: Knock at the Cabin
programme.desc: While vacationing at a remote cabin, a young girl and her parents are taken hostage by four armed strangers who demand that the family make an unthinkable choice to avert the apocalypse.

programme.title: Imaginary
programme.desc: When Jessica moves back into her childhood home, her youngest stepdaughter, Alice, finds a stuffed bear named Chauncey; Alice's behavior becomes more and more concerning, Jessica soon realizes that Chauncey is much more than a toy.
